intro: Salix huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén willow, is a species of flowering plant in the willow family, Salicaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. This shrub or small tree typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often near streams or in mountainous areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its catkins are a characteristic feature of the genus. The plant is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local wildlife.
